org.sedml
Class Libsedml

java.lang.Object
  org.sedml.Libsedml

public class Libsedml
extends Object

Provides an entry point to the SedML object model To read a SED-ML file, 

 SEDMLDocument doc = Libsedml.readDocument(myFile);
 // get errors 
 List<SedMLError> errors = doc.getErrors();
 
 // alternatively, if you're creating a SED-ML document from scratch, do 
 doc = LibsedML.createDocument();
 //get model
 Sedml model = doc.getSedMLModel();
 
 // apply changes to your model using the SED-ML API
 
 // write document back to file
 doc.writeDocument(myFile);
 
 // to write a .miase archive file with the model file included: 
 
 List<IModelFile> models = new ArrayList<IModelFile>();
 models.add(new FileModelContent(myModelFile));
 ArchiveComponents comps = new ArchiveComponents(models, doc);
 
 byte[] zippedBytes = LibSedml.writeMiaseAchive(comps);
 
 // persist your zipped archive

Author:
Richard Adams

createDocument

public static SEDMLDocument createDocument()
Creates a new, empty SED-ML document

Returns:
A non-null, empty SEDMLDocument. This document is not free of errors after creation, as a valid document contains at least one task, for example.

writeMiaseArchive

public static byte[] writeMiaseArchive(ArchiveComponents components)
                                throws XMLException
Generates a zip archive of a SED-ML document and its constituent model files. Within the archive, the SED-ML document will called 'sedml.xml'

Parameters:
An - ArchiveComponents object.
Returns:
A byte[] of the zipped contents, or null
Throws:
XMLException - if any aspect of zipping could not be performed.

readMiaseArchive

public static ArchiveComponents readMiaseArchive(InputStream archive)
                                          throws XMLException
Reads an archive, which should be in Miase format - i.e., a zip archive containing a SED-ML file and possibly one or more model files.

Parameters:
archive - An InputStream onto the archive
Returns:
A non-null ArchiveComponents objects.
Throws:
XMLException
{@link - IllegalArgumentException} if parameter File is null, unreadable, or does not end in ".miase" or ".zip".

parseFormulaString

public static ASTNode parseFormulaString(String math)
Convenience method to parse free text math into an ASTNode. The style of math is a C-style syntax, e.g.,
. The parsing supports standard arithmetical operations and function calls. E.g.,
  • 4 + 2
  • sin(pi / 2) // or any other trig function
  • log(9,81) // = 2
  • root(4,81) //=3
  • exp(t)

In addition, the strings pi, NaN, infinity and exponentiale are translated into constants.

Functions not supported by this library ( see ASTFunctionType for supported functions ) will be parsed into a function call, which will not be evaluable. E.g., 
    myfunction(a, b)
can be turned into an ASTNode, but will not be evaluable.

Parameters:
math - A String of math
Returns:
An ASTNode. This will be an ASTRootNode with the math nodes as children. E.g., the string 
 2 * (4 / 5)
will return the structure: 
  ASTRootNode
       ASTimes
            ASTCn(2)
            ASTDivide
                 ASTCn(4)
                 ASTCn(5)
